basics.name: Aritra Chakrabarty
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: Graduate student in Electrical Engineering with experience in vehicle system integration and testing, specializing in ADAS features.

work.name: APTIV
work.summary: Managed testing tasks for vehicle level system testing and was the lead technical contact for team members and stakeholders.
highlights: Aligned scope and milestone-based timing.
Developed the testing framework.
Provided regular result updates and final test status reports.
Evaluated and monitored progress for risks in system testing.
Supported development of problem resolution planning.
Standardised testing methodologies across all projects.

work.name: APTIV
work.summary: Conducted closed-course vehicle testing on various test tracks and proving grounds.
highlights: Specified instrumentation and equipment for test vehicles.
Designed, created and implemented automated data analysis MATLAB scripts.
Created test procedures, plans and test reports.
Lead on-road Autonomous Vehicle testing for data collection and product validation.

work.name: APTIV
work.summary: Brought up ADAS/AD systems on both bench and vehicle level using CAN tools.
highlights: Developed and debugged test system configurations.
Identified component integration issues and drove them to resolution.
Supported vehicle instrumentation setup for recording CAN data.
Verified system functionality and reported defects.
Performed verification testing activities.

work.name: SGS IBR Laboratories (Contracted through Kelly Engineering Services)
work.summary: Performed test procedures for filtration systems and masks (NIOSH, AFNOR).
highlights: Calculated and diagrammed detailed test setups.
Selected and calibrated appropriate measurement equipment.
Gathered data and compiled it for final test reports.

volunteer.summary: Led the reports team and co-captained the team during the 2018 season.
highlights: Designed & built gearbox for power transmission.
Co-captained team during the 2018 season to build the first car for the team.

volunteer.summary: Led a team of Senators to achieve their improvement goals for the university.
highlights: Worked on multiple committees and meetings involving school officials and faculty.
